law.catch_line: Medical recipients to pay allowable nominal copayments -- Administrative regulations.

text.section: The cabinet shall institute nominal copayments or similar charges to be paid by medical assistance recipients, their spouses, or parents, under the provisions of Section 1916 of Title XIX of the Federal Social Security Act, 42 U.S.C. sec. 1396o.

Standard nominal copayments per service, not to exceed amounts allowable under Section 1916 of Title XIX of the Federal Social Security Act, 42 U.S.C. sec. 1396o shall be collected by the provider and charged for the following services:
Ambulance services which are provided to recipients in need of nonemergency health transportation services;
Nonemergency services delivered in a hospital emergency room; and
Prescription and over-the-counter drugs, subject to the limitation under subsection (6) of this section.

No provider participating in the Medical Assistance Program shall deny services to any eligible recipient due to the inability of a recipient to make the required copayment. This provision shall not excuse the recipient from liability for payment of the charge.
The cabinet shall promulgate administrative regulations under KRS Chapter 13A to implement the provisions of this section.
Any copayment for a prescription or over-the-counter drug shall not exceed one dollar ($1).
